references.paper_title: Sense less, generate more: Pre-training lidar perception with masked autoencoders for ultra-efficient 3d sensing
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel generative sensing approach for LiDAR, significantly improving efficiency by reducing data collection while maintaining accuracy, a core theme of the main paper.

references.paper_title: STARNet: Sensor trustworthiness and anomaly recognition via approximated likelihood regret for robust edge autonomy
references.reason: This work presents STARNet, a crucial anomaly detection mechanism discussed in the main paper to enhance the reliability of sensing-to-action loops.

references.paper_title: Robokoop: Efficient control conditioned representations from visual input in robotics using koopman operator
references.reason: This paper introduces RoboKoop, a method for optimizing action-to-sensing pathways through efficient control, which is a key strategy detailed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Adaptive-spikenet: event-based optical flow estimation using spiking neural networks with learnable neuronal dynamics
references.reason: This paper explores neuromorphic computing for efficient sensing and processing, a key area that the main paper advocates for in edge autonomy.

references.paper_title: DC-NAS: Dynamically Configurable Neural Architecture Search for Federated Learning
references.reason: This paper addresses the challenge of hardware heterogeneity in multi-agent systems by dynamically adapting model architectures, a crucial aspect of achieving efficiency and scalability in distributed environments, as mentioned in the main paper.
